name: API Sync
description: Automates exporting/importing to/from remote REDCap servers via the API.  The Data Dictionaries for the local and remote projects are expected to be either identical or compatible.  This module could easily be expanded to support additional scenarios (like automatically syncing the data dictionary as well).

project-settings.name: Error Recipients - If left blank, errors will be sent to all users with design rights
Log Request Contents - Only check this TEMPORARILY while debugging, or a significant amount of space will be used in the database

Exports
Exports overwrite remote data with local data. Automatic exports of fields changed since the last export (according the the 'Logging' page) can be configured below. Initial exports (or exports delayed due to misconfiguration or cron issues) will only sync changes up to one week ago for performance reasons. All records may also be exported at once via the API Sync page/link in the left menu.

Weekly/Daily/Hourly Export Minute (0-59)
• The minute on which weekly, daily, or hourly exports will occur
• If omitted, neither weekly nor daily nor hourly exports will occur

Weekly/Daily Export Hour (0-23)
• The hour on which weekly or daily exports will occur
• If omitted, exports will occur hourly. However, weekly or daily exports are recommended whenever possible to minimize server resource usage

Export Day of Week (0-6)
• The day of the week on which the export will occur. Sunday = 0, Monday = 1, ..., Saturday = 6.
• Requires that Export Hour is set.
• If omitted, exports will occur daily

Max Records Per Batch
This value should be left blank to allow auto-calculation unless a more optimal size for the project/servers has been carefully calculated, and the sync is monitored to ensure it completes as quickly as possible to avoid consuming significant server resources

Max Megabytes Per Sub-Batch
This value defaults to 7 if left blank. It should be set only with great care while monitoring the sync to ensure it completes as quickly as possible to avoid consuming significant server resources

Imports
Imports overwrite local data with remote data. Imports can be configured to occur automatically below, or can be triggered manually via the API Sync page/link in the left menu. Imports may take a long time on large projects. In one test case an import took 15 minutes for a project with about 10,000 records and 1,500 fields.

Filter Logic - Used to limit which records are included in the sync. This will include records in the same way that a report would that uses the same logic and displays only record IDs. ALL events & instances are synced for matching records
